mng: palm of the hand, sole of the foot, paw, horseshoe, to slap, to hold in one's hand, to wield

exm.mng: to grasp (often fig.), to control, to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny), to master, to know well, to understand sth well and know how to use it, fluency
to clasp hands, to put one's palms together (in prayer)
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom), to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
to wield (political etc) power, be in power
palm of the hand, classifier: slap
